briefTitle: Vascular Implications of a Naturally Occurring Asthma Exacerbation
officialTitle: Vascular Implications of a Naturally Occurring Asthma Exacerbation

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* between the ages of 18 and 55 years old
* waist circumference less than 88 cm for women and 102 cm for men.
* Asthma participants will be recruited from the University of Alberta Emergency Department with asthma exacerbation as their primary reason for visit.
* healthy controls will be recruited from the general population according to the same criteria, but with no history of asthma.

Exclusion Criteria:

* known heart failure or unstable cardiac disease,
* lung diseases other than asthma,
* known chronic inflammatory condition other than asthma
* known metabolic disease
* current infections,
* smoking history \> 10 pack years,
* or waist circumference \>88 cm for women and \>102 cm for men

primary.description: Percent change in diameter in response to shear stress
primary.timeFrame: Emergency Department (ED), 48 hours and 14 days post ED for asthmatics, 2 time points 48 hours apart for controls.

secondary.description: A marker for systemic inflammation and immune response

other.description: Physical activity measured during first 2 weeks of recovery following an asthma exacerbation
other.timeFrame: Fitbit worn in asthmatics for 7 days following 48 hour timepoint
